results.firPara: The 19-year-old Football League young player of the year, arguably the brightest rising star in the Championship, signed a four-year deal with Bournemouth for an initial £6m, potentially rising to £10m.
results.secPara: A central midfielder who, as the Leedss best player, gave even the most cynical, dejected fans at Elland Road reasons for hope last season, is a product of the Yorkshire clubs academy, where he followed Fabian Delph, now at Manchester City, off the production line.
results.webTitle: From ‘the bulldog’ to ‘the next Busquets’: 10 Premier League signings to watch

results.firPara: In todays Fiver José and Juan. Plus Darius Vassell, Bobby Mancini and more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver José and Juan. Plus Darius Vassell, Bobby Mancini and more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Giving a toy to a child and then taking it straight back

results.firPara: Arsène Wenger goes into possibly his final season as Arsenal manager admitting he is scared by the prospect of retirement and uncertain he will be able to cope as well as Sir Alex Ferguson without the daily fix of football management.
results.secPara: Wenger, approaching 20 years in charge of the London club, talks about how difficult it will be to break the addiction in a far-reaching interview in which the 66-year-old also explains why he is so cautious to show more muscle in the transfer market and bemoans the lack of hunger among some of his younger players.
results.webTitle: Arsène Wenger admits he is scared by the prospect of Arsenal retirement

results.firPara: Plus Chicago Fire extend winless away streak; Nick Rimando deserves recognition as a goalkeeping great; Kei Kamara an awkward fit for Revolution
results.secPara: Plus Chicago Fire extend winless away streak; Nick Rimando deserves recognition as a goalkeeping great; Kei Kamara an awkward fit for Revolution
results.webTitle: Nicolás Lodeiro is the man to save Seattle Sounders' season; and Red Bulls fume

results.firPara: Guardian writers predicted position 17th (NB this is not necessarily Louise Taylors prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 season preview No12: Middlesbrough

results.firPara: Paris Saint-Germain have confirmed the signing of Jesé Rodriguez from Real Madrid on a five-year contract, with the Spain forward becoming the Ligue 1 champions fifth signing of the season.
results.secPara: The 23-year-old found game time hard to come by at the Santiago Bernabéu and bids farewell after nine years with the club. Having made his debut for Real in the 2011-12 season, he went on to make 62 appearances in La Liga, scoring 12 times. He was also part of the Champions League winning squads in 2014 and 2016.
results.webTitle: PSG announce signing of Jesé Rodriguez from Real Madrid on five-year deal

results.firPara: Katrien Meire, the controversial Charlton Athletic chief executive, has been appointed to the FA Council as one of four Football League representatives.
results.secPara: The 32-year-old Belgian lawyer, who took over the day-to-day running at The Valley in January 2014 after Roland Duchâtelet bought the south London club, has been met by widespread criticism from Charlton fans as the club were relegated to League One last season amid chaos on and off the pitch.
results.webTitle: Charlton’s controversial chief executive Katrien Meire joins FA Council

results.firPara: Internazionale and Roberto Mancini have parted ways by mutual consent and the club are now expected to appoint Frank de Boer with two weeks to go until the beginning of the new Serie A season.
results.secPara: Mancinis last match in charge of Inter was a 6-1 friendly defeat to Tottenham on Friday and with De Boer a free agent having left Ajax at the conclusion of last season, the clubs new owners, Suning Holdings Group, decided to act.
results.webTitle: Inter set to appoint Frank de Boer after Roberto Mancini’s departure confirmed

results.firPara: There was a twinkle in Philippe Montaniers eye. What do you want to know? You know everything, he said when there was a brief pause before the waiting journalists asked him a question, following Nottingham Forests 4-3 win over Burton on Saturday.
results.secPara: Anyone can afford to be jovial after a home win but there already seems a confidence and assurance to the new Forest manager one competitive game into his tenure. In his press conference, when he was not lightly ribbing the interpreter he occasionally uses but does not really need, the Frenchman admitted this was a victory with difficulties and there was plenty to work on, a mild weakness of the kind new managers might not usually reveal.
results.webTitle: Nottingham Forest make bright start as Philippe Montanier gives youth a chance | Nick Miller

results.firPara: Three error-strewn years and a botched succession have not been forgotten as United look to make a concerted assault on the title under José Mourinho
results.secPara: Guardian writers predicted position Champions (NB this is not necessarily Paul Wilsons prediction but the average of our writers tips)
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 preview No11: Manchester United
